posts.name: G3 6740
posts.cooked: Hello, i’ve been having trouble connecting to my trams robot, so I decided to try connecting directly from my laptop to the RIO via ethernet cable and I still don’t get communications on the driver station, right now i’m trying to find a quick solution to connect the pheonix tuner x so i can sort out some ID’s .can anyone help?

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked: try using a usb-a to b cable (sometimes called a printer cable) and see if it connects

posts.name: G3 6740
posts.cooked: Still no commes, should i diconnect the ethernet cable or something?

posts.name: Nolan Barker
posts.cooked: What’s the state of the roboRIO’s status lights? Also, any screenshots would be helpful - does your computer recognize that an ethernet network is connected?

posts.name: G3 6740
posts.cooked: The rio comm light just turned on/red but i have commes on the driverstation…

posts.name: G3 6740
posts.cooked:
well now i have commes on the driverstation but i’m having issues on tuner x

posts.name: Mete Karadeniz
posts.cooked: Do you have a Limelight or another interface to check if there is a connection between them? We had the same issue before we could access the Limelight interface, but there were no comms in the Driver Station.
